授業目的: This course introduces students to current debates from around the world on the position of religion in contemporary society. It encourages students to explore the complex relation between religion and society in the context of secularism, liberal democracy, and globalization.
到達目標: After taking this course, students will have a deeper understanding of the significance and complexity of such fundamental modern concepts as religious freedom, human rights, citizenship, secularism, democracy, and multiculturalism. They will also have improved skills of expository writing and argumentation.
授業方法:
Class discussion, mini lecture, essay writing, presentation. Zoom lessons for students who have received permission to study online. This course will be offered in an on-demand format through Monday, October 11.
When the number of registered students is finalized and the classroom environment standards are met, the class will be held face-to-face.
If the standards are not met, the course will continue to be offered in an on-demand format for health and safety reasons.
